stories.text:
As of a few minutes ago, it prompted me to update my settings:

"GitHub Copilot can allow or block suggestions matching public code. See GitHub Copilot FAQ to learn more."

The FAQ appears to be missing.
stories.title: Tell HN: GitHub Copilot can now block suggestions matching public code

stories.text:
I like the look of Adobe's Ten Mincho and its consistency with Garamondesuqe Latin characters, but I dislike the fact that the font is exclusive to TypeKit. Source Han Serif seems quite thin in comparison but takes up more horizontal space at the same size.

Any other alternatives, even if it means buying them out right?
stories.title: Ask HN: Best free/cheap Japanese Mincho (serif) fonts for paper and web

stories.text:
I'm a programmer that's mostly worked with Python so far in my career. At various points, I've run into performance bottlenecks that others have solved by writing high-performance libraries in C++ and Rust, mainly for things like data iterators and network servers.

What are some good resources to learn how to write high-performance and low-latency code that can interface with popular languages like Python in 2022? There are a lot of open-source libraries I can analyze and study, but often I feel like the techniques and optimizations they use go way over my head.
stories.title: Ask HN: Resources to learn high-performance C++/Rust?
